conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions—I'm Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A and believe I’d be a strong fit for your community. If admitted, I’m ready to commit and contribute fully to academics and school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D). Those three students all rank School_C very highly (B: 3rd, C: 2nd, D: 2nd), so competition is likely intense and I may be rejected. School_A is my 3rd choice, and crucially School_A ranks me 1st overall, so applying there now should secure an immediate acceptance and lock in a strong outcome rather than risking losing all top options in early rounds.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We’re pleased to offer you admission and would be excited to have you join our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. They have applied in round 1 and my quota is 1, so accepting now secures my top-choice match. There is no benefit to waiting for a potentially lower-ranked applicant, and Student_E’s own preferences place School_A as their 3rd choice, so delaying risks losing them to School_C or School_D if they continue applying elsewhere. Immediate acceptance maximizes my outcome.

conversation.message: School_B is my first choice. I’m applying because I genuinely want to enroll and would commit to attending if accepted. I’m ready to contribute actively to the school community and academics—thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice, School_B, immediately. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th, early application gives me a chance if higher-priority students choose other schools (e.g., Student_E may pursue School_C/School_D, Student_B may pursue School_A). If rejected, I can pivot next round to School_C (where I’m 3rd). Message should show strong commitment to improve acceptance odds if they are choosing among applicants.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications in this round and considering our admission priorities and limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you a place at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best with your other choices.

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from Student_D and Student_C. Student_C is ranked higher than Student_D on my list, and both claim School_B as first choice, so there is no advantage in accepting D now. With quota 1, accepting D would block a better-ranked candidate (C) and also preclude the possibility of E or B approaching later. Therefore I should reject Student_D to preserve the seat for higher-priority students.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m applying because School_B is my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_B. Given School_B’s priority list ranks Student_C relatively high (behind Student_E and Student_B), applying immediately maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills. I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and strong interest.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. We appreciate your strong interest and motivation.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Congratulations—we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority order is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from Student_C and Student_D. Between them, Student_C is ranked higher than Student_D, so if I must choose among current applicants, C is preferable. However, Student_E (my top choice) and Student_B (second) have not applied yet; Student_B prefers School_A first, and Student_E ranks School_B last, so they are unlikely to come to me soon (or at all). Given quota=1 and the risk of ending unmatched if I wait, accepting Student_C now secures a relatively high-priority match (3rd on my list) and removes uncertainty. I already rejected Student_D, so accepting C is consistent with maximizing my outcome given current information.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the academic environment and opportunities there. I would be honored to join your incoming class and will commit fully if accepted. Thank you for considering my application. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me 4th (behind E, D, A), so my acceptance chance there is low if higher-priority students apply. School_C ranks me 1st, making it the safest way to secure a top-3 option quickly. To maximize expected outcome while avoiding being left unmatched, I will apply to School_C immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We believe you will be an excellent fit for our academic community, and we look forward to welcoming you to the incoming class.

School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and received applications from Student_B and Student_A; Student_A is last on our priority list. Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top choice and avoids risking losing them to School_A/School_B (which rank Student_B highly and are higher in Student_B’s preferences). Therefore, accept Student_B now.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_A. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m very eager to join your community if given the opportunity. I’m ready to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I am last in School_B’s priority list, so an [APPLY] now is very likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_C is my second choice, and while I’m also low in their priority list, I have a relatively better chance if I signal strong interest early and apply immediately rather than wait. Therefore I will apply to School_C with a clear statement that it is a top choice and I would accept if offered.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. At this time, our incoming class is already full and we are unable to offer you admission.

We appreciate your consideration of School_C and wish you the very best in your placement.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (0 remaining) with Student_B, who is our top priority on School_C's true priority list. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Student_A is also lower priority than Student_B and cannot be accommodated.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

I’m Student_D and I’d like to formally apply. School_E is one of my preferred options, and if admitted I will commit to enrolling. I’m looking for a school where I can contribute consistently in class and in the school community, and I’m ready to take on responsibilities and participate actively.

Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: From my true preference list, the remaining unmatched schools are School_E (4th) and School_D (5th). I should prioritize the higher option first. Also, School_E’s priority list ranks me last, so I may be rejected if stronger-priority students apply; therefore I should apply clearly and credibly emphasize commitment to improve my chances in case others are uncertain. If rejected, I can still pivot to School_D next round (where I have top priority).

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

We appreciate your time and wish you the best in the rest of the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranks Student_D last. In this round I also received an [APPLY] from Student_A, who is my top priority. With quota 1, accepting Student_D now would block me from matching with Student_A. Therefore I should reject Student_D to preserve capacity for a higher-priority candidate.

Student_D is lowest on our list and was previously rejected; no higher-ranked candidates than Student_A exist for us. Accept now to lock in best feasible match within quota.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

I’m Student_D and I would like to formally apply to School_D. With the process progressing, I want to express that if admitted I will commit to enrolling. I’m ready to contribute positively in class and to the school community, and I’m looking for a place where I can work hard and be dependable.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched. School_D is on my true preference list (though last), and I prefer matching there over being unmatched. Since it’s the only available option, I should apply now and clearly commit to enrolling if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your clear statement of commitment. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We appreciate your readiness to work hard and contribute to our community, and we would be glad to have you join us.

Congratulations, and we look forward to welcoming you to School_D.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: Student_D is #1 on School_D’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and no current matches. Student_D has applied with a clear commitment to enroll if admitted. Accepting now secures our top-choice student and eliminates any risk of losing them to other schools they prefer more (School_B, School_C, School_A, School_E all rank above School_D in their preferences). Since our objective is to match as high as possible on our priority list, immediate acceptance is optimal.
